channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023110121
item.description:
Report E-2023110121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 leaked during transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel transferred the UN2920 corrosive liquid from the damaged drum into one (1) new 55-gallon poly drum to be shipped to its next destination. The damaged poly drum was cut up with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum, along with the general cleanup debris.

item.title: Report X-2023101119
item.description:
Report X-2023101119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX GROUND PACKAGE SYSTEM, I
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found in a tote in the unload by door 1-2 by unload managers at the start of sort. The package was missing contents and the lid was not secured, however, the outer packaging was already dry. Managers notified QA and QA immediately took the damaged hazmat to be processed DescribePack: The package appears to have been crushed causing the lid to pop off. The only liquid left in the plastic container was about 1/8 of a gallon. The package was dry by the time it was found by the unload DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a red tote with a hazardous materials bag and placed in a well ventilated area.

item.title: Report X-2023100831
item.description:
Report X-2023100831

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: SAINT JOSEPH
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered when a package handler brought to us on a pallet smoking not soon after sort started. No flames seen, just white chemical smoke. We enclosed in flapped smalls tote outside. Brought bucket of water outside next to door just in case it was needed. Stopped smoking within the hour, once we opened it up and got the peanuts out of the way. DescribePack: Loose cap not tightened. I didn't notice any cracks in the base of the bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Placed product in plastic tote outside.

item.title: Report X-2023100825
item.description:
Report X-2023100825

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Open and leaking package came down the QAT on the 1/3/5 side with strong odor of alcohol. Package did not have a diamond or any other signifier on package to indicate 99.8% isopropyl alcohol was in it. DescribePack: Cap to one of the bottles was loose. Contents of bottle leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined tote and immediate brought to the haz cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100704
item.description:
Report X-2023100704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE UNLOADER VACATED THE AREA, NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER VESSELS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP BY 3/4 OF A TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 120 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

item.title: Report X-2023100790
item.description:
Report X-2023100790

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Plastic bottle of undeclared UN1268 leaked when top was broken off during sorting. Outer packaging was FedEx plastic bubble pack. No dg markings. spill cleaned locally and secured in salvage drum for FAA inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023100600
item.description:
Report X-2023100600

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found on the I-C belt placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The cap on 1 of the bottles came out and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The tot was brought back to pallet the cage and placed on the Flammable pallet.
